=Walkthrough: Qizmt SQL Extension (contd)=

16.	Now that the name of the _underlying rectangular binary MR.DFS file_ is known to be _dfs://RDBMS_Table_paintings@644_, a mapreducer can be written to produce another MR.DFS file containing the count of each unique word in the _title_ field of every tuple of the _paintings_ table.


----


17.	Launch the _Qizmt IDE/Debugger_ with a new job file called MyPaintingsWordCount.xml by issuing the following command at the windows command prompt: 

*qizmt edit MyPaintingsWordCount.xml*


<wiki:comment>Image:</wiki:comment><img src="http://qizmt.googlecode.com/svn/wiki/images/QSQL_EditPaintingsWordCount.png" alt="Qizmt edit" />


----


18.	This will bring up the _Qizmt IDE/Debugger_ with a default mapreduce example, unless MyPaintingsWordCount.xml already exists in the _MR.DFS_.


<wiki:comment>Image:</wiki:comment><img src="http://qizmt.googlecode.com/svn/wiki/images/QSQL_EditorPaintingsWordCount.png" alt="Qizmt edit" />
